website_summaries.verdict: The Adidas Pureboost RBL was a fantastic running shoe according to several users, based on favorable comments regarding its performance. There were a few who doubted the shoe’s durability and longevity. Despite some criticisms, many purchasers have concluded that the Adidas Pureboost RBL was a good investment for a neutral running shoe.
pros: The Adidas Pureboost RBL was perfect for both city running and walking, according to several wearers
Numerous runners were pleased with the water-repellent feature of the shoe
There were a lot of positive comments regarding the shoe’s design
Others also mentioned the suitability of the shoe for casual wear
A lot of reviewers claimed the Pureboost RBL was a comfortable shoe
The shoe provided excellent heel support, especially during running, said a commenter
The Pureboost RBL was able to maintain a stable ride on uneven surfaces, stated a buyer
cons: One wearer thought the shoe fit smaller than expected
The sides of the shoe wore down quickly, a disappointed user said
A commenter reported that the side of the shoe got soaked easily after running on wet pavement

customer_reviews.title: Poor design choices or defects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes on Oct 23rd and have been using them since they arrived on Oct 25th. Not even 2 months of every day runs of 3.5 miles. There are two rectangular hard plastic parts on the heel of the shoes that have started sticking through and scraping off layers of my skin. I'm not 100% sure why they would even put something so hard and sharp on such an expensive running shoe. I take responsibility in not returning them sooner, but unfortunately I cannot recommend these shoes just based on the design decisions alone. I can see this happening to anyone that purchases these shoes and uses them consistently like I have.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Bollinger

customer_reviews.title: Different then normal Pureboost shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Ben running halves and marathon in Adidas Pureboost since they came out. Love that they are lightweight provides great cushioning for a guy my size (5'11" 195lbs). These are a little different in that around the ankle there is kind of wrap-around material. I bought these for casual so I'm good with them.
customer_reviews.author: RLierman

customer_reviews.title: Do not mistaken for Adidas BOOST shoes...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is more like an aqua sock. It looks like a running shoe but has virtually no heel, arch or foot support and the sole is NOT similar to the regular BOOST sole. This sole is very thin and not fit to support any running or sport activity. Quite disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: The Django

customer_reviews.title: Lv them...
customer_reviews.text: I really Lv these Adidas.. the look, how light they are, though worn all day (for the first time) they did leave a tight squeeze like feeling on the big toe.. yet Wont stop using them.. maybe not all day..!0!
customer_reviews.author: Bladerunner

customer_reviews.title: Trusted Amazon seller.
customer_reviews.text: The sale price under 50 dollars. The collar keeps pebbles out of sneaker. The boost cushion is good for running and walking. Will buy again when they go on sale
customer_reviews.author: Duck

customer_reviews.title: You might need to go a 1/2 size lower
customer_reviews.text: So all my shoes(8) and clothes are adidas. Majority or probably all of my shoes fit at 9 and 1/2. but with this shoe i had to get it at a 9. It fits perfectly, feels flexible as i dance, run and train in combat. Pretty nice shoe! i dont feel like it has any arc support so nevermind that for people who are looking for that feature but that aside all is great! definitely worth the buy! the material of the shoe is sturdy too!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Pierides

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable, A+ shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the adidas brand and this shoe. This shoe is so comfortable and it looks great. I've had multiple people at the gym ask where I got them. I use them for HIIT workouts, going for a long walk, or just a daily wear around town. Great cushion in the heel and a soft landing when leaving the ground. Because they have the knit, they stay true to shape. The arch is kind of low, probably ok for people with normal arches. I have a more flat foot, so I had to purchase higher arch sport insoles, good that the existing insoles are removable. A+ shoe
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sharrock

customer_reviews.title: The Quality of Adidas vs Nike's show-off
customer_reviews.text: I trust Adidas, never failed me for the past 15yrs after leaving Nike for good. Nike were more about promoting their brand and making you pay for it. Adidas is quality itself, value for money, worth it, and has convenient quality products that last for +3yrs.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, can be tight on ankle/top of foot
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes - the sole is by far the best material I’ve found to stand on all day. My only issue is that there is elastic surrounding the ankle which becomes tight after wearing for a few minutes. And there’s really no way to stretch it out. I have pretty slim ankles but the pressure on top of the foot can get to be a bit much.
customer_reviews.author: AT McD

customer_reviews.title: Great Sneakers Look Great and are so comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. I had to order a whole size up for best fit. These are snug but ultimately comfortable. Very light weight and you get a bounce when you walk. Great for running or hiking or just looking great! I got 2 more in different colors. I'm a bit hooked.
customer_reviews.author: WMLA

customer_reviews.title: It's NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Full stop it's not waterproof. Comfortable for sure which is why I keep it. But not waterproof and my feet were drenched in a rainy day wearing this pair of shoe. .
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but no support
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable and airy, However, I would not do any athletics in them. For example, tennis. There is no arch support and nothing around the ankles. I like to wear them around town though.
customer_reviews.author: Timmie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and great running shoe. Although, it could just be me, I have gotten blisters on my achilles the first few times I’ve ran in them. They could either be a tad to big or I need to break them in more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot spots that will burn your flesh off
customer_reviews.text: High back of the shoe creates a spot for contact near the top of your foot. Unless you wear high socks you are going to have a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am flat footed and have dystonia in my right foot. I bought these shoes for a comfortable fit but they fail in that department for my kind of feet. I recommend Under Armour Charged for these type of feet
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sock like fitment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sneaker sock like fitment love them will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Brian devolve

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My some wears them almost daily. They have held up well and. Are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: mbyrd35

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: No tongue and very soft cuff around the ankle. I was worried it would bother me but you don’t notice it at all.
customer_reviews.author: evan mcnair

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable shoes I’ve worn! I use it to work where I’m almost always on my feet: no more heel pain! The material on the upper conforms to my foot shape and adds additional support. Water resistance is also a plus. Definitely a recommended buy!
customer_reviews.author: WolfPrime

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe to run in
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of me getting this show is to run in and it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Joey C. Stukes

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: nice shoes and fit well for running on wet days, waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Teresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly too big compared to other Adidas shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I own many Adidas shoes- Ultraboost, NMDs, etc. I am normally a size 11.5 in Adidas, but these I should have ordered an 11. Comfort is decent but not as plush as Ultraboost.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers! There super comfortable with a lot of support!
customer_reviews.author: Pat k.

customer_reviews.title: 👌🏼
customer_reviews.text: Cool look really nice from adidas, and comfortable for running
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I dont like at all. Not so comfortable as they say Bigger than expected but really tight If i live in the states i Will return it for sure
customer_reviews.author: Estela I.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fit great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the boost line for the gym, 3rd pair I've bought!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin matsako

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations. Good quality. Comfortable run. It actually fits like a sock because of the way the upper is designed. Great shoe
customer_reviews.author: rojoyo

customer_reviews.title: Top Shelf
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very comfortable, and they give you snug fit with a shock bounce feel.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence willis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned this "new" type of running shoe. I like it very much. Often Adidas are too narrow for me. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative for the expensive Ultraboost!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and feels comfortable. Especially at this price, it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sai Kamalnath

customer_reviews.title: Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good performance running shoes for athletes. Good snug fit. Although the shoes can survive to an extent, don't use for cross fit or other activities that involve a lot of lateral movement.
customer_reviews.author: Harish Radhakrishnan

customer_reviews.title: Not Pleased with my order
customer_reviews.text: I got two different colors with my order and I want a refund or a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I get lower leg pain while running wearing this shoe. My heel slides to the side.
customer_reviews.author: Hari

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is true to size. It’s a light running shoes but has great support for your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff on the heel
customer_reviews.text: It easily hurts your heel before it adjusts to your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Good snickers for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my son he is size 14 yeah huge size for him and fit really good like the material and different color . He loved
customer_reviews.author: Adiazbeth

product_meta.title: adidas mens CM8309 Pureboost Rbl
product_meta.description: Winter weather can't keep you inside. These natural running shoes have a knit upper that's designed to trap heat and a waterrepellent finish that protects against icy splashes. A high collar provides protection against the elements, and the allterrain outsole helps keep footing secure on a...
feature_bullets: Weight: 11.3 ounces (size 9); Midsole drop: 8 mm (heel: 10 mm / forefoot: 18 mm); Arch type: Normal; Regular fit; Lace closure
Water-repellent knit upper for durability; Reflective details
Stretchweb rubber outsole flexes underfoot for an energized ride; All Terrain outsole for supreme traction
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
